Title:
Neodactylariales (Dothideomycetes, Ascomycota): a new order
of ascomycetes including a new family, Neodactylariaceae, and a new
species from China.
Abstract:
During a mycological survey of aquatic hyphomycetes
occurring on submerged decaying leaves in Yunnan Province, China, an
unidentified fungus was collected. The collection was cultured and
sequenced, and a Blast search of the nuc 28S rDNA sequences revealed
dothideomycetous affiliation, which close to the genus Neodactylaria,
but without a close match to a specific family or order. Phylogenetic
analyses of a multigene matrix containing a representative selection of
Dothideomycetes from four genes (nuc 18S rDNA, nuc 28S rDNA, rpb2 and
tef1) revealed placement within Dothideomycetes but without a supported
familial or ordinal affiliation. Based on the phylogenetic analyses and
morphological investigations, the new species Neodactylaria simaoensis
are described and illustrated, and placed in the new family
Neodactylariaceae and new order Neodactylariales.
